intro: Pilosella patagonica, commonly known as the Patagonian pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Pilosella patagonica is often used in floral arrangements due to its long-lasting blooms and delicate appearance.
